Key Match Events: Babar Azam remained unbeaten to take Pakistan home
Shaheen Shah Afridi led the way with the ball with three early wickets and finished the contest off with two sixes
Mohammad Amir and Haris Rauf joined Shaheen among the wickets as Ireland were reduced to 32 for 6
Gareth Delany and Mark Adair gritted their way through a 44-run partnership off 30 balls
Imad Wasim took care of the lower order with figures of 3 for 8 in four overs
Josh Little took Ireland to 106 with a cameo of 22
Abbas Afridi swung his way through a happy-go-lucky 17 to bring the target down to 12
Shaheen trapped Harry Tector in front in his next over
Little and Ben White batted the remaining six overs, adding an unbeaten 26 for the last wicket
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan secured a three-wicket win that gave them relief rather than satisfaction

Pakistan needed 55 in 12 overs with eight wickets in hand, with Babar and Fakhar Zaman batting, when Zaman drilled one to mid-off. It was the catalyst for flutters through the whole of the Pakistan camp
Usman Khan was deceived by McCarthy's extra bounce in the tenth over
Shadab flicked his second ball to the wicketkeeper
Imad finally connected with the cut shot he's been trying since Ravindra Jadeja bowled against him, but straight to the man at point
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan fans with a message for their team in Lauderhill
Pakistan's jitters in the middle overs
An unassertive top order and a non-existent middle order won't get you out of the first round at many World Cups
This game was the perfect illustration of the point
